attributes.action: Stop houses being built in bulk in Cornwall until infrastructure is improved.
attributes.additional_details: Large housing developments are destroying the natural beauty of Cornwall. The County is being ruined for those who live here and for tourists during the summer, who have to battle through traffic for hours only to find that wherever they are going is being built on and their day is ruined by loud construction work and a return journey full of traffic.
attributes.background: In Cornwall there are inadequate facilities available to those who live here. With so many houses being built in the county the amount of traffic and accidents are increasing. Houses should not be allowed to be built by companies unless they help improve Cornwall for those that already live here.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Local planning issues are the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use the following pages to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

Alternatively, you could start another petition asking for the Government to provide funding to improve infrastructure in Cornwall.
